title: Fifty-Fourth Army (Japan)
text:
The was an <a href="corps">army</a> of the <a href="Imperial%20Japanese%20Army">Imperial Japanese Army</a> during the final days of <a href="World%20War%20II">World War II</a>.
History.
The Japanese 54th Army was formed on June 19, 1945, under the <a href="Japanese%20Thirteenth%20Area%20Army">Japanese 13th Area Army</a> as part of the last desperate defense effort by the <a href="Empire%20of%20Japan">Empire of Japan</a> to deter possible landings of <a href="Allies%20of%20World%20War%20II">Allied forces</a> in central <a href="Honsh%C5%AB">Honshū</a> during <a href="Operation%20Downfall">Operation Downfall</a>. The Japanese 54th Army was based in <a href="Shinshiro%2C%20Aichi">Shinshiro</a>, <a href="Aichi%20Prefecture">Aichi Prefecture</a> and was thus intended to guard the approaches and beachheads to <a href="Nagoya">Nagoya</a> and the <a href="Ch%C5%ABbu%20region">Chūbu region</a> of Japan. It consisted mostly of poorly trained <a href="military%20reserves">reservists</a>, <a href="military%20conscription">conscripted</a> students and <a href="militia">home guard militia</a>. Most of its units were still in training, and had neither weapons nor ammunition at the time of their <a href="demobilization">demobilization</a> at the <a href="surrender%20of%20Japan">surrender of Japan</a> on August 15, 1945, without having seen combat.
